description:
If you’re the kind of gamer that likes to fully escape in a fantasy title, then you definitely should pick up a curved monitor, as it’s designed to engulf you in digital worlds. Fortunately, Amazon is selling the Dell S2722DGM for just $249.99, which is 17 percent off of the original $299.99 price. Not only does this monitor have a curvature of 1500R, but it also has a high refresh rate of 165Hz, so you can expect fluid visuals and (hopefully!) no stuttering issues.

The Dell S2722DGM has a 27-inch panel, a resolution of 2560×1440, a maximum brightness of 500 nits, and a response time of 1ms. Given those numbers, th
title: Pick up this curved 1440p Dell gaming monitor for just $250

description: Whether you’re looking for a powerful gaming laptop, a lightweight rig for working on the go, or a laptop to kick back with to watch Netflix on the sofa, chances are you’ll find what you’re looking for among Dell’s extensive portfolio of laptops. title: Dell XPS vs. Inspiron vs. Latitude laptops: Which should you buy?

description:
If your Windows 11 PC has failed a Windows Update session in the last week or so, there might be a very specific reason for it. According to a German tech site, Windows 11 version 24H2 (currently in testing among Windows Insiders) has a surprisingly expansive list of apps that will block it from updating. These include a few power user favorites, like StartAllBack.

get windows 11 pro for cheap

Windows 11 Pro
title: Windows 11 might not update if you have these popular apps installed

description:
Copilot Pro delivers the power of the AI chat tool Chat-GPT directly to your Microsoft Office applications and the Windows sidebar. The tool summarizes texts, replies to emails, creates new texts, analyzes Excel spreadsheets, and creates presentations.

A miracle machine that does all your Office tasks for you automatically? We took a look at the tool.

Further reading: 5 Windows 11 settings worth changing immediately
title: Copilot Pro: What can Microsoft 365’s premium AI do?

description:
Nausea. A sharp pain in one side of the head. Light sensitivity that feels like you’re being stabbed in the eye. When a migraine headache has you in its grip, the last thing you may want to do is work on your laptop.

I don’t suffer from migraines, but my wife does, and has for years. Obviously, the last thing you want to do is stare at a screen. But if you have to, these are the tips that my wife swears by to make life more bearable.

Further reading: The best laptops we’ve tested

1.) Isolate external lights

Migraine sufferers can experience severe light sensitivity, which is one of the triggers
title: How to work on your laptop with a migraine
